kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT INJECTION RATE measures the total number of defects (bugs) detected for a story

operands: No. of defects tagged to all stories closed in a sprint
Total no. of stories closed in the sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lower the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect injection rate between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: FIRST TIME PASS RATE measures the percentage of tickets that pass QA first time (without stimulating a return transition or defect tagged)

formula.lhs: First time pass rate (FTPR) for a Sprint
operands: No. of issues closed in a sprint which do not have a return transition or any defects tagged
Total no. of issues closed in the sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of first time pass rate between last 2 sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT DENSITY measures the total number of defects against the size of a story

operands: No. of defects tagged to all stories closed in a sprint
Total size of stories closed in the sprint

details.value: The KPI is applicable only if the estimation is being done in 'STory Points'
It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lower the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect density between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT SEEPAGE RATE measures the percentage of defects leaked from the current testing stage to the subsequent stage

operands: No. of  valid defects reported at a stage (e.g. UAT)
Total no. of defects reported in the current stage and previous stage (UAT & QA)

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lesser the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect seepage rate between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT REMOVAL EFFICIENCY gives a measure of the development team ability to remove defects prior to release

operands: No. of defects fixed in a sprint
Total no. of defects reported in a sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect removal efficiency between last 2 sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT REJECTION RATE measures the effectiveness of a testing team

operands: No. of defects rejected in a sprint
Total no. of defects reported in a sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lesser the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect injection rate between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT COUNT BY PRIORITY measures number of defects for each priority defined in a project

formula.rhs: No. of defects linked to stories grouped by priority

details.value: It is calculated as ‘Count’. Lower the count, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect count by priority between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT COUNT BY RCA measures number of defects along with the root cause of defects

formula.rhs: No. of defects linked to stories grouped by Root Cause

details.value: It is calculated as ‘Count’. Lower the count, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect count by RCA between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: REGRESSION AUTOMATION COVERAGE measures progress of automation of regression test cases

operands: No. of regression test cases automated
Total no. of regression test cases

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of regression automation coverage between last 2 sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: IN-Sprint AUTOMATION COVERAGE measures progress of automation of test cases created within the Sprint

operands: No. of in-sprint test cases automated
Total no. of in-sprint test cases created

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of in-sprint automation coverage between last 2 sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints

kpiInfo.definition: UNIT TEST COVERAGE is a measurement of the amount of code that is run by unit tests - either lines, branches, or methods.

formula.lhs: The calculation is done directly in Sonarqube

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Unit test coverage between last 2 weeks. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: SONAR VIOLATIONS highlight count of issues that exist every time a piece of code breaks a coding rule. The set of coding rules is defined through the associated Quality profile for each programming language in the project.

formula.lhs: Issues are categorized in 3 types: Bug, Vulnerability and Code Smells

details.value: All these issues are categorized into 5 type of severity: Blocker, Critical, Major, Minor, Info
A progress indicator shows trend of Unit test coverage between last 2 weeks. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: SONAR TECH DEBT explains the estimated time required to fix all maintainability Issues/ code smells

formula.lhs: It is calculated as effort to fix all Code Smells. The effort is calculated in minutes and converted to days by assuming 1 Day=8 Hours.

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Days’. Lower the days, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Sonar Tech Debt between last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive.
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: CHANGE FAILURE RATE measures the proportion of builds that have failed for whatever reason over a given period of time

operands: Total number of failed Builds
Total number of Builds

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lower the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Change Failure Rate between last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 weeks
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 weeks, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: TEST EXECUTION AND PASS PERCENTAGE measures the percentage of test cases that have been executed & the percentage that have passed.

details.value: It is calculated as
No. of executed test cases out of total test cases in the latest execution of a sprint
No. of pass test cases out of executed test cases in  the latest execution of a sprint
It is calculated in ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Unit test coverage between last 2 Sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints

kpiInfo.definition: STORY COUNT measures the overall work taken in a sprint

formula.lhs: No. of stories tagged to a Sprint

kpiInfo.definition: SPRINT VELOCITY measures the rate at which a team can deliver every Sprint

formula.lhs: Sum of story points of all stories completed within a Sprint

kpiInfo.definition: SPRINT CAPACITY UTILIZATION depicts the maximum amount of time a team can commit within sprint

details.value: This KPI is calculated based on 2 parameters
Estimated Hours: It explains the total hours required to complete Sprint backlog
Logged Work: The amount of time team has logged within a Sprint

kpiInfo.definition: AVERAGE RESOLUTION TIME measures average time taken to complete an issue that could be a story or bug etc.

formula.lhs: Sum of resolution times of all issues completed in the Sprint/No. of issues completed within a sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Days’. Fewer the days better is the ‘Speed’
A progress indicator shows trend of Average Resolution Time between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: MEAN TIME TO MERGE measures the efficiency of the code review process in a team

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Hours’. Fewer the Hours better is the ‘Speed’
A progress indicator shows trend of Mean time to merge in last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 weeks

kpiInfo.definition: Sprint Predictability signifies who stable is a team's velocity such that it can be used in forecasting milestones in future

operands: sprint velocity in last sprint.
sprint velocity in last 5 sprint

kpiInfo.definition: NUMBER OF CHECK-INS helps in measuring the transparency as well the how well the tasks have been broken down. NUMBER OF MERGE REQUESTS when looked at along with commits highlights the efficiency of the review process

details.value: It is calculated as a Count. Higher the count better is the ‘Speed’
A progress indicator shows trend of Number of Check-ins & Merge requests between last 2 days. An upward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: CODE BUILD TIME measures the time a job takes to build the code.

details.value: It is calculated in  ‘Mins’. Lesser the time better is the ‘Speed’
A progress indicator shows trend of Code Build Time between last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of 5 weeks

kpiInfo.definition: LEAD TIME is the time from the moment when the request was made by a client and placed on a board to when all work on this item is completed and the request was delivered to the client.

formula.lhs: It is calculated as the sum Ideation time, Development time & Release time

details.value: Ideation time (Intake to DOR): Time taken from issue creation to it being ready for Sprint.
Development time (DOR to DOD): Time taken from start of work on an issue to it being completed in the Sprint as per DOD.
Release time (DOD to Live): Time taken between story completion to it going live.
Each of the KPIs are calculated in 'Days' . Lower the time, better is the speed & efficiency of that phase
A progress indicator shows trend between last 2 months. An downward trend is considered positive.

kpiInfo.definition: DEPLOYMENT FREQUENCY measures how often code is deployed to production

formula.rhs: It is calculated as No. of deployments done on a environment in a month

details.value: It is calculated as a 'Count'. Higher the count during a month, more valuable it is for the Business or a Project
A progress indicator shows trend of Deployment frequency between last 2 months. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: Release Frequency highlights the number of releases done in a month

formula.rhs: Number of fix versions in JIRA for a project that have a release date falling in a particular month

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Count’. Higher the Release Frequency, more valuable it is for the Business or a Project
A progress indicator shows trend of Release Frequency between last 2 months. An upward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: Cost of delay (CoD) is a prioritization framework that helps a business quantify the economic value of completing a project sooner as opposed to later.

formula.lhs: COD for a Epic or a Feature
formula.rhs: User-Business Value + Time Criticality + Risk Reduction and/or Opportunity Enablement.

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Days’. Higher the CoD for a feature or an Epic, more valuable it is for the Business or a Project
A progress indicator shows trend of CoD between last 2 months. An upward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT INJECTION RATE measures the total number of defects (bugs) detected for a story

operands: No. of defects tagged to all stories closed in a sprint
Total no. of stories closed in the sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lower the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect injection rate between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

formula.lhs: First time pass rate (FTPR) for a Sprint
operands: No. of issues closed in a sprint which do not have a return transition or any defects tagged
Total no. of issues closed in the sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’

Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints

kpis.kpiName: Ticket open vs closed rate by type

details.value: This can be filtered based on issue type

details.value: "before d1" count in below table is not added in "d1" count

Aggregated value for P1 is 15.

kpiInfo.definition: TOTAL TICKET COUNT BY PRIORITY measures the overall open tickets by priority during a defined period grouped by priority

details.value: Decrease in net open ticket count is considered as positive

formula.rhs: Total # of tickets in a day grouped by root cause.

details.value: i.e. "before d1" count in below table is added in "d1" count
Trend is of selected date range and for RCA as per value in configuration .Default is last 7 days.
Aggregation strategy is summation. Example:
Aggregated value for Code Issue is 30.
Maturity :

kpiInfo.definition: CHANGE FAILURE RATE measures the proportion of builds that have failed for whatever reason over a given period of time

operands: Total number of failed Builds
Total number of Builds

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lower the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Change Failure Rate between last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 weeks
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 weeks, the Maturity level will not be shown

formula.rhs: # of Executed Test Cases / # of Total Test Cases.
# of Test Cases Passed / # of Test Cases Executed.

details.value: The trend is of selected date range. Default is last 7 days
Each sprint show latest Test execution done in a particular sprint duration.
Aggregation strategy is Average criteria. Example:
Aggregated value for above example is 15 %.
